description: From New Latin redactiō (“redaction”), from Latin redigō (“to lead back, collect, prepare, reduce to a certain state”), from red- (“back”) + agō (“to put in motion, to drive”).

entries.meaning: (countable) Edited or censored version of a document.
examples: The government supplied only the redaction to the reporters; the original was kept secret.

entries.meaning: (countable) The change or changes made while editing.
(uncountable) The process of editing or censoring.
examples: The Expense Claims made by Members of Parliament must be subject to redaction before publication under the Freedom of Information Act.
